Articles.Content:
I’ve launched 2 geostationary missions. The first one, the kraken shook apart. Presumably because of the robotic parts.

     The second, I had a similar design without the robotics. I don’t have a picture, but look up Matt lowne’s most recent geostationary network. Mine are carbon copies of his. The kraken shook them to peices. I attempted to deorbit the spinning satellites, and one almost did until- BOOM! 6 new peices of debri in orbit. The second, BOOM! 4 more peices. The third, the kraken tolerated and was successfully deorbitted. 
Luckily, I had a quicksave, and am going to deorbit the entire upper stage, satellites attached.
